revision.text:
{{spanish name|Guaita|Panadero}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Vicente Guaita | image = Vicente Guaita.jpg | image_size = | caption = Guaita as a [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] player in 2009 | fullname = Vicente Guaita Panadero{{cite web|url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/vicente-guaita-panadero/62971/|title=Guaita: Summary|website=Soccerway|publisher=Perform Group|accessdate=10 June 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|1|10|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Torrent, Valencia|Torrent]], Spain | height = 1.90 m | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | clubnumber = 31 | youthyears1 = 1995–2000 | youthclubs1 = Monte-Sión | youthyears2 = 2000–2006 | youthclubs2 = [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] | years1 = 2006–2009 | clubs1 = [[Valencia CF Mestalla|Valencia Mestalla]] | caps1 = 18 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2008–2014 | clubs2 = [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] | caps2 = 76 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2009–2010 | clubs3 = → [[Recreativo de Huelva|Recreativo]] (loan) | caps3 = 30 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2014–2018 | clubs4 = [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] | caps4 = 108 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps5 = 11 | goals5 = 0 | totalcaps = | totalgoals = | club-update = 21:58, 27 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Vicente Guaita Panadero''' ({{IPA-es|biˈθente ˈɣwaita panaˈðeɾo}};{{efn-lr|In isolation, ''Guaita'' is pronounced {{IPA-es|ˈɡwaita|}}.}} born 10 January 1987) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|CrystalP}} club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. He appeared in 176 [[La Liga]] matches during eight seasons with [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] and [[Getafe CF|Getafe]], as well as a season on loan with [[Recreativo de Huelva|Recreativo]] in the [[Segunda División]]. ==Club career== ===Valencia=== Born in [[Torrent, Valencia|Torrent]], [[Valencian Community]],{{cite news|url=http://www.superdeporte.es/joan-carles-marti/2011/06/02/der-guaita-nacido-parar/129415.html|title=Van der Guaita, nacido para parar|trans-title=Van der Guaita, born to stop|newspaper=[[Super Deporte]]|first=Joan Carles|last=Martí|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=28 May 2011|accessdate=12 June 2018}} Guaita graduated from the [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] youth system after arriving there from CD Monte-sión at the age of 13,{{cite news|url=http://www.publico.es/actualidad/guaita-portero-del-valencia-dice.html|title=Guaita, portero del Valencia, dice que debe seguir apretando para que no le quiten lo que {{sic|nolink=y|tienen}} ahora|trans-title=Guaita, Valencia goalkeeper, says he must keep pushing so that they do not take him what he has now|newspaper=[[Público (Spain)|Público]]|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=31 May 2011|accessdate=12 June 2018}} being promoted to the first team for the [[2008–09 La Liga|2008–09 season]] following the retirement of longtime incumbent [[Santiago Cañizares]]. Additionally, as German [[Timo Hildebrand]] became ostracized by coach [[Unai Emery]], he became the backup.{{cite news|url=https://as.com/futbol/2008/10/13/mas_futbol/1223879212_850215.html|title="Sería un orgullo seguir a Sempere o Palop"|trans-title="I would be proud to follow on Sempere or Palop's footsteps"|newspaper=[[Diario AS]]|first=M.|last=Gimeno|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=13 October 2008|accessdate=12 June 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://cadenaser.com/ser/2008/10/28/deportes/1225153695_850215.html|title=Emery: "Me da vergüenza ajena que el Madrid se queje de los árbitros"|trans-title=Emery: "I find it shameful that Madrid complain about refereeing"|publisher=[[Cadena SER]]|language=Spanish|date=28 October 2008|accessdate=12 June 2018}} Guaita made his official debut with the main squad on 2 October 2008, in a [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] tie against [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]] ([[2008–09 UEFA Cup|2–1 home win]]).{{cite news|url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2008/10/03/mas_futbol/1222984801_850215.html|title=El Valencia se clasifica sufriendo|trans-title=Valencia go through suffering|newspaper=Diario AS|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=3 October 2008|accessdate=4 March 2014}} However, after the signing of veteran [[César Sánchez]] from [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] later in the year and the full recovery of [[Renan Brito Soares|Renan]], he remained third-choice until the end of the campaign.{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/deportes/2010/12/03/actualidad/1291364519_850215.html|title=El examen tranquilo de Guaita|trans-title=Guaita's peaceful test|newspaper=[[El País]]|first=Rosa|last=Sulleiro|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=3 December 2010|accessdate=12 June 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://www.lasprovincias.es/20130227/deportes/valencia/cesar-guaita-valencia-mejor-201302271637.html|title=César: "Guaita es el portero con más condiciones del fútbol español"|trans-title=César: «No goalkeeper in Spanish football is more blessed than Guaita»|newspaper=[[Las Provincias]]|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=27 February 2013|accessdate=12 June 2018}} In [[2009–10 La Liga|2009–10]], with Sánchez having renewed his link a further year and the signing of [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]]'s [[Miguel Ángel Moyá]], Guaita was deemed surplus to requirements and joined, on loan, [[Segunda División]]'s [[Recreativo de Huelva]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hortanoticias.com/noticia/373868/Torrent/guardameta-vicente-guaita-jugar%C3%A1-cedido-valencia-cf-recreativo-huelva.html|title=El guardameta Vicente Guaita jugará cedido por el Valencia CF en el Recreativo de Huelva|trans-title=Goalkeeper Vicente Guaita will play with Recreativo de Huelva on loan from Valencia CF|publisher=Horta Noticias|language=Spanish|date=24 August 2009|accessdate=22 January 2013|dead-url=yes|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130216053550/http://www.hortanoticias.com/noticia/373868/Torrent/guardameta-vicente-guaita-jugar%C3%A1-cedido-valencia-cf-recreativo-huelva.html|archive-date=16 February 2013|df=dmy-all}} As the [[Andalusia]]ns [[2009–10 Segunda División|finished comfortably in mid-table]] he was awarded the competition's [[Ricardo Zamora Trophy]], with just 24 goals conceded in 30 appearances.{{cite web|url=http://huelva.eldesmarque.com/recreativo/22495-guaita-ya-es-el-zamora-de-la-categoria|title=Guaita ya es el Zamora de la Segunda División|trans-title=Guaita is already the Zamora in ''Segunda División''|publisher=El Desmarque|first=Álvaro|last=Ramírez|language=Spanish|date=13 June 2010|accessdate=12 January 2018}} In November–December 2010, profiting from injuries to both César and Moyà, Guaita had a run of several matches for Valencia, notably a 2–1 home win against [[UD Almería|Almería]] in [[La Liga]]{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/301980/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Soldado at the double for Valencia|website=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=28 November 2010|accessdate=22 January 2013}} and a [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|1–1 draw]] away to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for the [[UEFA Champions League]].{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/307806/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Anderson makes precious point|website=ESPN Soccernet|date=7 December 2010|accessdate=22 January 2013}} On 2 April 2011, as he had established himself in the starting XI, he suffered the loss of his father due to a heart attack (aged only 46),{{cite web|url=http://vcfcentral.com/latest-news/mata-we-scored-quickly-and-that-gave-us-confidence/|title=Mata: We scored quickly, and that gave us confidence|website=VCF Central|date=4 April 2011|accessdate=10 April 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322134448/http://vcfcentral.com/latest-news/mata-we-scored-quickly-and-that-gave-us-confidence/|archivedate=22 March 2012}} prompting manager Emery to reinstate César between the posts for two games.{{cite news|url=http://ecodiario.eleconomista.es/futbol/noticias/2959026/04/11/Cesar-se-convierte-en-el-portero-con-mas-edad-que-juega-en-Primera.html|title=César se convierte en el portero con más edad que juega en Primera|trans-title=César becomes oldest goalkeeper to play in ''Primera''|newspaper=[[El Economista (Spain)|El Economista]]|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=2 April 2011|accessdate=12 June 2018}} In May 2011, Guaita extended his contract with Valencia until 2015.{{cite news|url=http://www.superdeporte.es/valencia/2011/05/31/guaita-queria-familia-anos-posibles/129684.html|title=Guaita: 'Tenía claro que quería quedarme en el VCF'|trans-title=Guaita: 'I was sure i wanted to stay with VCF'|newspaper=Super Deporte|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=31 May 2011|accessdate=31 May 2011}} He begun [[2011–12 La Liga|the season]] as the starter, but picked up a serious hand injury in early November 2011, being nonetheless selected to several games by Emery as the reserve.{{cite news|url=http://www.superdeporte.es/valencia/2011/12/21/mano-vuelve-frenar-guaita/148219.html|title=La mano vuelve a frenar a Guaita|trans-title=Hand stops Guaita again|newspaper=Super Deporte|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=21 December 2011|accessdate=26 January 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2012/01/04/futbol/equipos/valencia/1325669207.html|title=Guaita sólo para emergencias|trans-title=Guaita for emergencies only|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|first=D.|last=Picó|first2=D.|last2=Puig|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=4 January 2012|accessdate=26 January 2012}} ===Getafe=== [[File:Vicente Guaita.png|thumb|upright|Guaita in 2016]] On 31 July 2014, Guaita was sold to [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] with a buy-back option.{{cite web|url=http://www.valenciacf.com/ver/36608/comunicado-oficial---traspaso-de-vicente-guaita-al-getafe-cf-.html|title=Comunicado oficial – Traspaso de Vicente Guaita al Getafe CF|trans-title=Official announcement – Transfer of Vicente Guaita to Getafe CF|publisher=Valencia CF|language=Spanish|date=31 July 2014|accessdate=31 July 2014}} He made his debut for his new team on 24 August, in a 1–3 away loss to [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta]].{{cite web|url=http://espanol.eurosport.com/futbol/liga/2014-2015/en-vivo-celta-getafe-2100_sto4371941/story.shtml|title=Celta-Getafe: El mejor tridente para empezar (3–1)|trans-title=Celta-Getafe: The best trio to start (3–1)|publisher=[[Eurosport]]|language=Spanish|date=24 August 2014|accessdate=28 July 2017}} In the [[2016–17 Segunda División|2016–17 campaign]], with the club again in the second level, Guaita played little due to injury.{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/getafe/2016/09/27/57ea990f268e3e61298b4615.html|title=Guaita estará un mes y medio de baja por una lesión en la muñeca|trans-title=Guaita will be out for one and a half months due to a wrist injury|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=27 September 2016|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vavel.com/es/futbol/getafe-cf/792683-guaita-es-el-todo-u-otra-temporada-en-segunda.html|title=Guaita: "Es el todo u otra temporada en Segunda"|trans-title=Guaita: "Anything goes or another season in ''Segunda'' it is"|publisher=[[Vavel]]|first=Elena María|last=Pintado Nieto|language=Spanish|date=25 May 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}} He was, however, the starter in [[2017 Segunda División play-offs|the play-offs]], which ended in promotion.{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/segunda-division/2017/06/14/5941a291ca4741df0d8b460b.html|title=El Huesca no se rinde y levanta dos goles para soñar con la final|trans-title=Huesca do not surrender and come back from two goals to dream with final|newspaper=Marca|first=Juancar|last=Navacerrada|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=14 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/segunda-division/2017/06/17/59459713ca474116058b4613.html|title=El Getafe arrasa al Huesca y está en la final|trans-title=Getafe destroy Huesca and are already in the final|newspaper=Marca|first=Juancar|last=Navacerrada|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=17 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://www.20minutos.es/deportes/noticia/tenerife-gana-getafe-partido-ida-ascenso-primera-3071429/0/|title=El Tenerife da el primer paso hacia el ascenso al derrotar al Getafe en la ida con gol de Jorge|trans-title=Tenerife take first step towards promotion after defeating Getafe in first leg with goal from Jorge|newspaper=[[20 minutos]]|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=22 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/deportes/2017/06/24/actualidad/1498332522_361003.html|title=El Getafe regresa a Primera tras ganar al Tenerife (3–1)|trans-title=Getafe return to ''Primera'' after beating Tenerife (3–1)|newspaper=El País|first=Ladislao J.|last=Moñino|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=24 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}} ===Crystal Palace=== On 2 February 2018, [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] manager [[Roy Hodgson]] confirmed Guaita had agreed to join from 1 July on a [[Free transfer (association football)|free transfer]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/feb/02/football-crystal-palace-getafe-vicente-guaita-goalkeeper|title=Crystal Palace to sign Getafe goalkeeper Vicente Guaita in July|first=Dominic|last=Fifield|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|location=London|date=2 February 2018|accessdate=10 June 2018}} The transfer was reconfirmed by the club on 8 June, with the player joining on a three-year contract.{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/june/vicente-guaita-to-join-palace-on-1st-july/|title=Vicente Guaita to join Palace on 1st July|publisher=Crystal Palace F.C.|date=8 June 2018|accessdate=10 June 2018}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut on 15 December, keeping a [[Shutout#Association football|clean sheet]] in a 1–0 home win against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46491854|title=Crystal Palace 1–0 Leicester City|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|first=Jack|last=Skelton|date=15 December 2018|accessdate=22 December 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 27 February 2019}} {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|National Cup{{efn|Appearances in [[Copa del Rey]]}} !colspan=2|League {{notelist}} ==Honours== '''Getafe''' *[[La Liga play-offs|Segunda División play-offs]]: [[2017 Segunda División play-offs|2017]]{{cite web|url=http://www.laliga.es/en/live/temporada-2016-2017/laliga-123/43/tenerife_getafe |title=CD Tenerife vs Getafe CF live|publisher=[[La Liga]]|accessdate=10 June 2018}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.laliga.es/en/live/temporada-2016-2017/laliga-123/43/getafe_tenerife|title=Getafe CF vs CD Tenerife live|publisher=La Liga|accessdate=10 June 2018}} '''Individual''' *[[Ricardo Zamora Trophy]]: [[2009–10 Segunda División]] ==Notes== {{notelist-lr}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} *{{BDFutbol|8475}} *{{Futbolme profile|20750}} *[http://www.ciberche.net/histoche/jugador?player=730 CiberChe biography and stats] {{es icon}} {{Crystal Palace F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Guaita, Vicente}} [[Category:1987 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Torrent, Valencia]] [[Category:Spanish footballers]] [[Category:Valencian footballers]] [[Category:Association football goalkeepers]] [[Category:La Liga players]] [[Category:Segunda División players]] [[Category:Segunda División B players]] [[Category:Valencia CF Mestalla footballers]] [[Category:Valencia CF players]] [[Category:Recreativo de Huelva players]] [[Category:Getafe CF footballers]] [[Category:Premier League players]] [[Category:Crystal Palace F.C. players]] [[Category:Spanish expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in England]] [[Category:Spanish expatriate sportspeople in England]]
